betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§oMy consciousness fades in, my brain catching up to my body as the last of my atoms materialize. The teleporter ride was bumpier than normal, the fog in my head quite unusual. Something was definitely wrong.

    I drew sidearm quickly, realizing I was not at my planet side base. I was... outside? Was my teleporter signal hijacked again? Is the system on the fritz? I just repaired it...

    When I felt I was not in immediate danger, I decided to look at my personal AI Tablet to get a scan of the area.

    I pulled the slim, flat tablet from it's pouch on my side, only to find out it had changed. As had my sidearm, but that didn't concern me quite as much...

    Now my pAIT was a thin book instead of a flat tablet. In fact, I am dictating this journal into it right now. It was still a computer, but the cover was no longer marked with my own ship's flag, but with the words : §r

                  §l§nEscape from Minekov§r
                      §l§nSurvival Guide

§oThe moment I opened the electronic book, the screens came to life. My ship's flag popped up on the home screen, along with a title graphic with the same text as the cover. Before I could tap one of the icons, a familiar voice spoke to me.§r

    §2System Error. Galaxinet connection severed. Database corruption detected. Entering Condition 10 Situation. Analyzing and repairing...§r

    §oWell, it sounded like my AI. I let out a breath I had been holding. Condition 10 was serious, though. It meant it's 'persona' and any 'sociable' traits it was programmed with or 'learned' were disabled. §r

    §2Corrupted areas repaired and/or quarentined. Downgrading to Condition 8. Scanning immediate status.§r

    §oThat was a little better. Eight was still full serious mode. As it worked, I kept what had been my sidearm ready. Only now, it was a knife. I mean, it was a pretty big knife, but it wasn't the same as a gun.§r

    §2Global network detected. Security upgraded. Connecting....connected. Downgrading to Condition 5. Persona subroutines reactivated. Nice to see you're still alive, Bandit.§r

    §o"Bandit?," my pAI had a bad habit of calling me all manner of nicknames instead of my real name. I usually didn't mind, but Bandit was a new one.§r

    §2Your new nickname. You'll understand in a bit, my friend. For now, get to somewhere safe before night falls. I suggest constructing a shelter yourself. The current inhabitants aren't very friendly to guests.

§oWas this place safe? I guess. I didn't have my armored spacesuit on, or my phaser pistol, or any of my other belt gadgets I was so used to having.

    "Okay, what is going on, Z?" I asked my pAI after settling in to my hiding spot. Z was the name I'd given them so long ago I don't quite remember why.§r

    §2My background processes are currently scanning through that network I connected to. I'm amazed its still functioning at all. But that is definitely not the big problem here, Bandit.§r

    §o"And that is...?"§r

    §2We aren't in Kansas anymore, Dorothy. Or America. Or Earth. Or Dimension Minecraftia, for that matter.§r

    §o"What is this, an isekai or something"§r

    §2You could say that. Looks like we got dropped into one of the deeper parallel dimensions, Bandit. The fundamental rules are different here, it seems.§r

    §o"Like...?"§r

    §2Well, of the ones that determine your immediate survival... A majority of things cannot be crafted in this dimension.§r

    §oMy heart skipped a bit. Crafting was life and blood in Minecraftia. "What CAN I craft, Z?"§r

    §2According to the net, you can still craft many decorative blocks, basic tools, and any food. Looks like basic Iron tools are fine...if you can find Iron that is.§r

    §o"What does THAT mean?"§r

    §2§2You won't find ores just laying around in the ground. Just junk to scavenge through.§r

    §o"What happened to this place?"§r

    §2Oh, back to back world changing apocalypse events, tearing through the fabric of space and time and magic. You know, the usual. §r

    I opened my mouth to ask another question then closed it, and started to go through the implications.

§2Bandit? You've been quiet for almost ten minutes. Are you okay?§r

    §oI snapped out of my deep thoughts, rubbing my face a few times, "Yeah, sorry about that Z. We're definitely in a big pickle."§r

    §2Pickle factory.§r

    §o"No kidding. I've got a million questions but that's not going to keep me alive right now. Instead I'll just ask...Survival Guide?"§r

    §2When crossing dimensions, sometimes objects you carry transform into a similar analog object.§r


    §o"Except..."§r

    §2Your suit, tools, etc didn't all transfer over, yeah. Space time fabric holes is the best explanation I got, Bandit. You got a knife at least. And my pAI tablet. Or really, Survival Guide. I transformed into an ebook! A good one, at least. Most of my functions are intact. And I got some new ones it looks like? I'll explore those later.§r

    §o"Not knowing why is frustrating. But not much I can do on that, yeah. Okay, if I can't craft most things, how do I gear up to survive here? And get food? Growing things takes a while, and I can already feel myself starving..."§r

    §2Oh please. That stable Sushi pack you always carry survived. Eat that. As for the answer to both questions?

    Shoot and Loot. It's hunting time, Bandit.

§oAfter a short discussion with my pAI and getting a bit of a rest in, I gathered my gear and set out to start hunting. I made sure to mark my safe house on my map (using the J key), as I had the feeling I'd need a base of operations if I wanted any hope of getting out of here. 

    From what Z could gather, there were four factions at play in this world : 
 
    The remnants of civilized society were huddled in small villages that dotted the landscape. Dubbed simply §l§oVillagers§r§o, they farmed, traded, and just tried to survive day to day.

    A few survivors have set up a trade network. The §o§lTraders§r§o, as they called themselves, use the Global Network to buy and sell nearly everything. They don't just work with anyone, reputation is important to them. We'll have to find their representatives in world and gain their trust before we can work with them.

    Many survivors, however, did not band together for the greater good. Instead, the mantra of a dog eat dog world is apt, as they have gathered into roving gangs of §lScavengers§r§o, attacking villagers, traders, and each other for the supplies to survive.

    The last faction, and definitely the largest and always growing larger, are the §lMonsters§r§o. Twisted creatures, the undead, and more roam the abandoned cities, many of them attracted the discarded items of civilization.

    Our targets were the latter two. Some of them should have some stuff we can salvage for food, gear, and resources.

    Fighting is going to be deadly, I probably won't have time to search over most of what I loot until its safe.

§2Bandit, while you've been hunting, I have finally got in contact with a §lTrader§r§2. He says he's with the VanilModu Trading Company. They are usually the first contact for §lVillagers§r§2 who want to start working to become §lTraders§r §2or §lMercenaries§r§2, which took the name Bandit.§r

    §o"Oh, THATS why you chose that nickname this time?"§r

    §2I only saw references when I first started going through the Global Network information. They were seen in a positive light by some, and quite negatively by others, so I took a guess that it would fit.§r

    §oHm, an odd nickname for a Mercenary. I wonder if the word's definition was slightly different in this world, or if Z mistranslated something. Either way... "Okay, so how do I meet with this Trader?"§r

    §2You don't. Not yet that is. All Trader groups work off of reputation, and well, we have absolutely zilch reputation amongst them right now. 

    He says, however, that he's willing to start trading with us if you send him some Bread as a token gesture. Once you do, he'll connect a minimal part of his shop to our Survival Guide. If we fill a couple more of his requests, he'll offer more trades, and start talking with you to boot.§r

    §oI wonder if this was like breaking bread back home as a form of bonding? Either way, time to either grow some wheat or hunt down a bakery...

§2Bandit, the VanilModu Trader sent a note and a trade offer for you to get started : §r

§3-------------------
    Greetings, new mercenary. With the breaking of Bread, the VanilModu welcomes you to the trade network. 

    For now, you will only have us and a few other Trader groups to work with. Our stocks to you will be limited by your reputation with each of us. Likewise, what we are willing to purchase from you is likewise dependant upon your reputation.

    If you are in need of cash and resources, and you have a surplus of salvaged items, you can utilize the Flea Market.

    You can sell nearly any item in the Market. Whether it is worth anything is another matter, as the value of anything varies wildly. Usually, each item you sell with earn you a couple pennies at least, sometimes even more. 

    Occasionally, someone will trade you some resources for your item. Or they will trade you an unsearched piece of loot.

    And sometimes, you'll get nothing back. That is the risk of playing the Flea Market.

    Normally, the machine to access The Flea Market takes a bit of an investment. But for certain new Mercenaries, we offer a one time deal : Provide us 12 pieces of Unsearched Gear, and we'll give you enough to construct your own Flea Market kiosk.

    If you lose this kiosk, or wish to build more of them, it will cost you the usual price.
-------------------§r

    §oHm, with the variety of items I'm finding on these monsters, it might be a good idea to use this Flea Market, if only to get rid of excess junk and HOPEFULLY get something more useful.

§2So a Flea Market, in a post apocalyptic society? How strange, yet fitting.§r

    §o"That seems to be the order of the day. Is the Trader willing to talk with me yet?"§r§r

    §3Greetings, Bandit. Your assistant finally got us connected, I notice. Is your Survival Guide damaged?§r

    §oWhat did she... oh wait! Different dimension, things are different. Right then. "It IS acting a bit different than usual. But it seems to be okay for the most part."§r

    §3If you say so. It's difficult to track down a working Guide Laboratory, let alone someone who knows how to repair one. Where do you originate from, new Mercenary?§r

    §o"Well uh... you wouldn't believe me if I said..."§o§r

    §2You could say we've been in the dark about everything that's happened here.§r

    §oI was pretty sure letting on we were from another dimension was a good way to get us blacklisted from the Trader network, but before I could speak up...

    §r§3Dark... Oh no, are you two from one of the deep underground cave communities? Do you have a Core Drill or something?!§o§r

    §o...What?§r

§3    Or maybe one of those damned nuclear Vaults they tricked people into? §r

    §o...WHAT?§r

    §3You'd be far from the first in either case. But that's getting on a tangent. You want access to the Trade Network proper? You'll need Rank 2 with us VanilModu Traders first. Not too difficult, but it might take a bit of luck. It's quite simple, really : 

    We want to test your survivability. Send us all the items on the list. How you get them doesn't matter. Heck, you can purchase them from us and send em right back. Fill out the list, and I'll give you a special machine we've recently developed : The Cleansing Sieve, which breaks down Corrupted Ore and Compressed Ruins and finds useable material for you.
No Description

§3The backbone of modern civilization. Once we learned how useful Iron was, and its key to making Steel, we dragged ourselves out of the collapse of the Bronze Age and swung forward,

    Even now, with the ability to salvage vastly superior metals, we circle back around to Iron to keep us alive after the collapse.

    Oh, I highly suggest you keep  your money in stacks of Ten-Dollar Bills. Most Traders keep to that except for the high value items.
No Description
No Description

No Description
No Description

§3Do you have the Iron price, as they say? We can always use all the iron we can get. Tools, weapons, armor, and so much more needs it.

    A little note for you, Bandit. Most traders buy items for a quarter of their worth, and in much smaller batches.

    Doesn't seem like much? Well, keep in mind for the same items, you might get 1% of the value from the Flea Market. 

    If you're lucky, that is.

§3These strange containers are part living, did you know that? If you travel to the End (which is quite a mess, I have to say), you can find Shulkers amongst the eerie End Cities.

    Now, you could go and fight them and the Dragons and all manner of things, or for a pile of bills, you can get your own right from me.

    Oh don't mind the color, you can Sneak + Right Click a dye onto it to change the color.

    As well, if you pick up an item with your Cursor, you can Right Click it onto a Shulker Box in your inventory to put it inside (if it has space).

§3Modular Machines use a lot of smaller (well, relatively) components to make big machines that do specific tasks.

    The Machine Controller is the heart of every Modular Machine. It displays info on its current build and status if you Right Click it.

    Both the Flea Market and Cleansing Sieve machines require one Machine Controller.

§3Modular Machines use a lot of smaller (well, relatively) components to make big machines that do specific tasks.

    The Small Item Input lets you stash four stacks of items into it to wait for processing.

    This is used only in the Cleansing Sieve right now, which requires two of them.

§3Modular Machines use a lot of smaller (well, relatively) components to make big machines that do specific tasks.

    The Machine Gearbox contains a variety of mechanical components the machine utilizes in some way. Sometimes its sorting, sometime its grinding, sometimes its stamping.

    The Flea Market uses a single Machine Gearbox, while the Cleansing Sieve requires two of them.

§3Modular Machines use a lot of smaller (well, relatively) components to make big machines that do specific tasks.

    The Ludicrous Item Input can hold 32 stacks of items for processing, making it an excellent component for machines that work though lots of different items.

    The only machine that utilizes them right now is the Flea Market, requiring two of them.

§3Modular Machines use a lot of smaller (well, relatively) components to make big machines that do specific tasks.

    The Ludicrous Item Output can hold 32 stacks of items, perfect for machines that can put out lots of different items every cycle.

    The Flea Market uses two of these, while the Cleansing Machine requires only one.

§3Modular Machines use a lot of smaller (well, relatively) components to make big machines that do specific tasks.

    Machine Circuitry blocks contain intricate circuits, scanners, and more, making them perfect for tasks requiring finding and dealing with very specific things, such as cleaning corruption or scanning for knowledge.

    The only machine that requires Machine Circuitry is the Cleansing Machine.

§2Since we've gained reputation rank II with the VanilModu, they've been kind enough to get us in contact with a few other traders. Like our own dimension, this one has a mix of humans and anthros, called Beastfolk here. Seems the multiple catastrophies accelerated the evolution of many species, including this group called the Labrats.

    Here, I'll let them talk to you now, Bandit. : §r

§a-------------------
    Ah yes yes, hello Bandit. The VanilModu are very much kind to be bringing us new mercs to deal with. The world is dangerous, and many do not last long, no no.

    No doubt you've already had to deal with our small, unintelligent ancestors, yes? No? Perhaps your larders are a bit lessened of food? Holes in the wall? We can help you deal with them, but that is not our purpose in life. Our grand purpose!

    We wish to understand the universe. What makes every single thing, down to the basic elements. Then... we can rebuild it, yes yes. A better world. 

    Through Chemistry, we break it down.

    Through Engineering, we build it up.

    But what we lack is Materials. Money. Chemicals. Test subjects. 

    Can you help provide these, maybe yes? At least some money, and some of the basic materials we need. Provide these to us, and we'll provide you with SCIENCE!
-------------------§r

    §oKnowing there are both humans and anthros in this world is comforting in a way. The last dimensional mishap we had, the only sentient creature were slugs... slugs everywhere. That was... interesting.

    Tangents aside, the Labrats look like they'll give me access to the first thing I'll need if I want to fix this mess I've gotten myself into : chemistry equipment.

betterquesting:10.name:8: Z's Notes : Tag It and Bag It
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§2Okay, now that we've gotten a base up, gotten contact with the locals, it might be a good time to go over a few... changes this dimension has brought. 

    Right now I want to talk to you about your item highlights.§r

    §oHighlights? You mean the info box that pops up when I look at things in my inventory?§r

    §2I bet you've noticed theres a few extra lines on each one now, huh? I'm dynamically adding those as my subprocesses scan and incorporate new data from the Global Network.. §r

    §oWhat kind of things are you adding?§r

    §2Mostly I'm cataloguing what you can do with each item with Tags. This will make it easier for you to know what you can do with them.§r

    §oThat sounds useful. What tags do you have for me right now, Z?§r

    §2Right now, each item can have up to 5 tags : 

    §7§lLOOTABLE§r§2 : Nearly every item will have this tag. It just means you can find it out in the world, or as loot from enemies you hunt.§r

    §d§lCRAFTABLE§r§2 : Items with this tag are ones you can actually craft. Ingredients for the recipe might be ones you find in the world, grow yourself, or purchase in the shop. Generally, these items are either low tier gear, or building/decorative blocks.

    §c§lTRADEABLE§r§2 : Nearly every item you find can be sold on the Flea Market (Talk to the VanilModu trader, they'll explain the Flea Market!). Some items, though, are sought after by Traders. Any item with a Tradeable tag is sellable directly to a Trader. you might not have the Reputation, or the Trade group, unlocked yet though!

    §6§lPURCHASABLE§r§2 : These items are for sale by a Trader. You might not have the Trader or the Reputation for them unlocked yet, however.

    §k§r§kNOPE§r§4§lCORRUPTED§r§kNOPE§r§2 : Some items have been twisted and corrupted from all the calamaties that have befallen this world. There isn't much use for them, but a machine called a Cleaning Sieve can break down, clean up, and salvage anything useful out of these corrupted items.

§2Okay, now that we've gotten a base up, gotten contact with the locals, it might be a good time to go over a few... changes this dimension has brought. 

    Mostly about mining, since I know thats your favorite pasttime...§r

    §oIt's very relaxing! Wait, what's different here?§r

    §2I wonder if you've gone spelunking yet. You probably noticed there isn't much ore in the walls like back home. That's because geological forces formed differently here. §r

    §oThey formed differently?§r

    §2Before the calamities, ore didn't form in small pockets like you know it to. Five Iron Ore here, six Coal ore there, two Diamonds over there, right? Well, here, Ores used to form in giant, sprawling pockets. You could easily get half a bag full of Iron and Coal from a single deposit when you you found it.§r

    §oBefore? What about now??§r

    §2Unfortunately, the back to back calamaties broke some fundamental things with this universe. One of them is that every Ore has been corrupted. Whenever they are placed down, or form in the world, they immediately twist and corrode, transforming to match the twisted, condensed ruins all around.

    There might be a way to reverse the corruption, but for now the only thing we can do is use a Cleansing Sieve to find anything useful out of these Compressed Ruins. (The VanilModu Trader offers the Cleansing Sieve at Reputation II, to note!)

§3The Nether Star. A heavily condensed source of pure energy, gathered by the monsterous creature known as The Wither.

    Some mercenaries become quite skilled at taking down the three headed, destructive beast, going as far as creating elaborate arenas to battle with them.

§3One of the deadliest creatures, the Ender Dragon, resides in The End. A raging battle across the skies. And in the end, if you survive, a mysterious egg as a reward.

    There are a few things you can do with a Dragon's Egg. Just be careful not to poke it too hard, it tends to protect itself.

§3Are you strong enough to take down the horror known as The Wither?

    Simply place Soul Sand in a T (two block pillar, + one block on either side of the top block), then place one Wither Skull on each Soul Sand. A horrofying effigy for a terrifying creature.

    Oh, make sure you aren't around things you want to keep. The monster is quite destructive.

    The Nether Star it drops? I'll purchase from you.

§3Ready for a big fight, Bandit? Think you can steal the coveted Dragon Egg from the Ender Dragon?

    Do so, and we'll pay handsomely for it.

§3A strange doll, found in an old, abandoned mansion. Legend has it that this can protect you from death but once.

    Does it? I don't much want to tempt fate, do you?

§3A pair of wings to fly the skies, floating upon drafts and diving through rings. Well, maybe not that last thing, but the Elytra is a coveted item that can be found in the End Cities.

    We have many an End Explorer who comes back with them for sale, as they are quite useful, and can be attached to your chest armor if you want.
§3Gold, shiny and alluring, and useful for so many things, more than just decoration. Electronics can make good use of gold, for example.
§3The Trader's friend. Nice and heavy and always a fantastic bartering good. If you have a couple bars I'll gladly buy them from you.

§3The creepy Endermen pop in and out of existence at night, wandering the landscape. Word has they used to steal blocks and take them home to The End, but you seldom see them picking up more than dirt nowadays.

    Their Eyes contain special power, what we call Enderic power. Holding and Right Clicking with one will launch it out, then teleport you to wherever it lands.

§3Is your blade fast enough, Bandit? Fighting Endermen is no joke, as their teleportation powers have bested many a fighter.

    Their Eyes, which we call Pearls, fetch a decent price for just a pair.

§3Blaze Rods are the concentrated flames of the Nether... kind of. Really they just drop from Blazes, but they kind of embody everything the Nether is : lots of burning, hard to get around, bright and annoying.
§3A Stick of pure Fire. Quite a useful thing if you know how to utilize the heat within it.

§3Ghasts float through the Nether, letting out their creepy wails that echo through the red lands. Some say the monsters are collections of lost souls given a body. Others say its just a flying creature with a call that carries over the heated air easily.

    Either way, their tears are quite powerful.
§3The sad tears of a Ghast. It would be sadder if they didn't launch destructive fireballs the moment they saw you.
§3Diamonds make the world go round. They sparkle in the eye of guy, girl, businessperson, and thief alike. They can be used for decoration, for purpose, and everything in between.

§3Finding diamonds is a bit tough in this world. Used to be you could go deep underground, do a little prospecting, and with enough time and effort, voila, a diamond, no blood shed.

    Unfortunately, those days are long past. You might be able to find a diamond in the rough Compressed Ruins, but you are more likely to find one of the various thieves and monsters to be carrying one.

§3Emeralds have a deep, green alure to them, don't they? Catch the eye, reminding you of money in a way. Normal villagers deal in Emeralds quite often, so its always handy to have a couple in your pocket if you are traveling to a village.

§3Going trading in some Villages soon, Bandit? We can always use some more Emeralds, keeping a stockpile is a good idea as Villagers sometimes come across rare items we like to trade for.

    And usually they either trade Emeralds or stacks and stacks of the most mundane items. Not that I'm complaining, getting an Enchanted book for a big pile of feathers is a great trade off to us!

§3Redstone is a magical dust that can transmit a signal. It doesn't quite transmit Forge Energy unless its converted into some kind of cable, but it can be used to turn machines on and off, for example.

§3Once a plentiful and sought out source of signal transmission, and the basis of so many machines, nowadays Redstone Dust a bit harder to come by.

    You can sometimes sift some Redstone Dust out of the wreckage underground. We're always looking for more, as a little bit goes a long way in repairing Survival Guides and other electronics.

§3Nether Quartz is a rarer crystal than its Overworldian counterpart, which hasn't been seen in centuries (which begs to differ, is it really the rarer crystal now?).

    It's important in machinery, in decoration, and much much more.
§3While not as pretty as a Diamond or an Emerald, or as magically inclined as Lapis, Nether Quartz still has quite a bit of popularity.

§3Lapis isn't that popular for things like jewelry or decoration, despite how pretty it is when cut nicely.

    Lapis' major draw is its magical properties. It's the primary way to enchant one's gear with special properties, for example.
§3Lapis is a somewhat highly sought out resource for proto-mages these days. Even novice Mercenaries can, with the appropriate Enchanting Table, boost up their gear to survive a bit longer.

§3Fire and Lava aren't the only things that light up the horrors of the Nether. Giant hanging stalagtites of Glowstone can be seen dotting the ceilings, breaking down to dust at the swing of a pickaxe.

    The dust, and Glowstone itself, is quite bright, and easier to handle than trying to strategically dump buckets of Lava in your house to brighten the area.
§3If you are taking a trip to the Nether, we would gladly trade for some Glowstone Dust. It's fantastic for lighting things without requiring constant amounts of power.

§3Metal armor is all well and good, but nothing beats a pliant set of leather armor for looks and flexibility.

    Though it isn't as protective, many Traders prefer it as it doesn't slow them down when they need to retreat from a dangerous situation.

§3Chainmail is an art lost to time. The weaved rings of metal were good in blocking slashing cuts, and sometimes helped to pull arrows out without too much damage.

    When you purchase armor from us, you get to choose two pieces. Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings.

§3Gold Armor is fairly pretty, and can be seen as a sign of wealth. It isn't all that protective compared to Diamond armor, but it is quite enchantable. Many a thief has been surprised that their blade gets turned away.

    When you purchase armor from us, you get to choose two pieces. Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings.

§3The cream of the crop of vanilla armor. Resplended to look at, quite protective, enchantable, and the base of some more powerful armors.

    When you purchase armor from us, you get to choose two pieces. Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings.

§3Golden tools may not have the durability of the other vanilla tools, but they make up for it in being highly enchantable. 

    When you purchase tools from us, you get to choose two pieces. Either a Pickaxe or an Axe, and then either a Sword, a Hoe, or a Shovel.

§3The coveted Diamond Pickaxe and Diamond Sword. The durable Diamond Axe and Diamond Shovel.

    Don't worry about the Diamond Hoe though, it isn't useless since you didn't have to craft it.

    When you purchase tools from us, you get to choose two pieces. Either a Pickaxe or an Axe, and then either a Sword, a Hoe, or a Shovel.
§3Music makes the day go better, so they say. It's good to listen to uplifting tunes now and then. Some music is hard to find nowadays, and we always pay for any rare records you can find.

§3A weird leftover relic from centuries ago seems to be full sets of armor for... horses? Which is an interesting turn of events, as nowadays horses are quite popular among Traders, as vehicle fuel is harder to come by.

    The art of making horse armor has been lost even longer, and now they are both ancient relics and useful gear.

§3A weird leftover relic from centuries ago seems to be full sets of armor for... horses? Which is an interesting turn of events, as nowadays horses are quite popular among Traders, as vehicle fuel is harder to come by.

    The art of making horse armor has been lost even longer, and now they are both ancient relics and useful gear.

§3A weird leftover relic from centuries ago seems to be full sets of armor for... horses? Which is an interesting turn of events, as nowadays horses are quite popular among Traders, as vehicle fuel is harder to come by.

    The art of making horse armor has been lost even longer, and now they are both ancient relics and useful gear.

§3Encasing a Nether Star in Glass and Obsidian focuses the power into the sky. If you build a base of precious metals underneath it, you can tap into magical powers that infuse the area. Jump higher. Heal faster. Do more.

§3We've gotten a variety of simple machines for sale.

    Pistons push things.

    Dispensers dispense things. If its an arrow or a snowball, it fires them out.

    Droppers drop things.

    Observers observe the block in front of them, sending out a Redstone signal if it changes.

§3Want to get around a bit faster than on foot? Minecarts and rails are pretty old tech, but they don't require fuel to function and are quite reliable.

    We offer minecarts and a variety of basic rail types.

§3Sponges are odd things. Usually you'd only find them at your kitchen sink, but this sponge is a bit special. Place it down in some some water, such as a lake, and it'll absorb a large section of it. 
    
    Need to dry it out? Just toss it into a Furnace.
§3Got yourself a horse? You'll need a Saddle if you want to guide it while riding.

§3Mundane tools and armor can be transformed quite easily with application of some magic. The Enchanting Table can power up gear with a variety of enchantments, all for the cost of some XP and some Lapis Lazuli.

    It isn't as simple as slapping the tool onto the table and rubbing some Lapis onto it. You'll have to carefully select Enchantment pieces (sort of like Tetris pieces) and place them into a grid. With a bit of planning, a little bit of luck, you can get the enchantments you want.

    With each Enchantment table, we'll include a stack of XP bottles for you.

§3There's a bunch of things we sell that are nice to have around the house, or to help you get back home.

    The Jukebox plays any Music Disc you find.

    The Note Block plays a note when hit with a Redstone Signal. What note depends on what block its on.

    The Compass always points you towards what we call the 'world spawn'.

    The Clock shows you the time of day. Good if you are under ground and don't want to fight swarms of zombies out in the open.

§3We sell a variety of devices that can be used around your base.

    Hoppers pull items from any storage on top of them, and deposit them in the storage you point them at.

    The Ender Chest is a magical chest. When you open an Ender Chest, it opens to an inventory only you have access to. Any Ender Chest you open will lead to that Inventory.

    The Redstone Lamp lights up an area when supplied with a Redstone Signal.

    The Daylight Sensor will emit a Redstone Signal when Daylight is hitting it.

§2Since we've gained reputation rank II with the VanilModu, they've been kind enough to get us in contact with a few other traders. Like our own dimension, this one has a mix of humans and anthros, called Beastfolk here. Seems the multiple catastrophies accelerated the evolution of many species, including this group called the Labrats.

    Here, I'll let them talk to you now, Bandit. : §r

§a-------------------
    Ah yes yes, hello Bandit. The VanilModu are very much kind to be bringing us new mercs to deal with. The world is dangerous, and many do not last long, no no.

    No doubt you've already had to deal with our small, unintelligent ancestors, yes? No? Perhaps your larders are a bit lessened of food? Holes in the wall? We can help you deal with them, but that is not our purpose in life. Our grand purpose!

    We wish to understand the universe. What makes every single thing, down to the basic elements. Then... we can rebuild it, yes yes. A better world. 

    Through Chemistry, we break it down.

    Through Engineering, we build it up.

    But what we lack is Materials. Money. Chemicals. Test subjects. 

    Can you help provide these, maybe yes? At least some money, and some of the basic materials we need. Provide these to us, and we'll provide you with SCIENCE!
-------------------§r

    §oKnowing there are both humans and anthros in this world is comforting in a way. The last dimensional mishap we had, the only sentient creature were slugs... slugs everywhere. That was... interesting.

    Tangents aside, the Labrats look like they'll give me access to the first thing I'll need if I want to fix this mess I've gotten myself into : chemistry equipment.
No Description

§aCheese? Cheese! 

    If it isn't obvious, we love cheese, much yes.

    It is not too hard to make, so we will not pay much for it.

    But we have much many mouths to feed, so we always provide!

§aOur tiny ancestors are much trouble, yes yes?

    Quite a nuisance, even to us, we agree.

    Rat Traps are a good way to protect your stockpiles. Just place near them. Solves problem right quick!

§aFor as much trouble as our miniscule elders are, they can be quite useful yes? Yes. Very much so! Rats are smart creatures, and quite friendly with the right people!

    Are you the right people?

    Make cheese, is easy. Pour Milk into Cauldron, wait, then take out Cheese! Then craft cheese into smaller slices.

    Now drop these cheese wedges near wild rats. Feed it many cheese wedges! Five. Ten. Fifteen. Sometimes twenty cheeses needed! World is dangerous, trust is hard, yes?

    Watch for hearts. Then Rat is now friend! Right Click to open your pet rat's inventory! Can give him any kind of hat to wear. or item to carry. You can also train the rat with an  Upgrade, but that for another time!

    For now, want more rats? Can tame more. Want special rats? Then you need Rat Cage!

    Sneak and Right Click your Rat to put it on your shoulder. Then Sneak and Right Click cage to put into cage! Put male and female in cage with some cheese, and soon, baby rats!

    Can improve health of rats over generations. Get special fur patterns and colors.

    Rats can be a nuisance, but also great friends, yes?

betterquesting:10.name:8: [I] Buying : Rat Pelt and Raw Rat Meat (x5)
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§aCan you provide for us Rat Pelts and Rat Meat?

    Morbid? Yes no, maybe a little. But can explain!

    Many of the rat families span generations, many many generations. Back to when only a few Beastfolk existed, mostly in legend!

    Rats were a common creature for testing. Very popular! Some of those rats survived, changed. Superpowers? Maybe. Longer lives. Stronger. Who knows!

    We have bounty on meat and pelts. We can study them, yes. Maybe learn more!

§2Since we've gained reputation rank II with the VanilModu, they've been kind enough to get us in contact with a few other traders. Like our own dimension, this one has a mix of humans and anthros, called Beastfolk here. No Description
No Description

§aOh? Have you found one of these? The little cousins like stealing them from our labs. Shiny and smell faintly of cheese.

    They are the base for our research. With them, we can make special Rat Upgrades for you! We will pay you for each one you find, yes yes!

betterquesting:10.name:8: [I] Selling : Cheese Staff and Rat Flute (+Gift)
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§aDo you have many rat friends yet, Bandit? Good and helpful, yes?

    But they can be even more helpful! You can command them to move stuff between chests, or harvest crops for you!

    To do this, you need... a Cheese Stick! And a Rat Flute!

    The Cheese Stick lets you tell Rats what chests to use! (Right Click to say "Put stuff here!" and Sneak and Right Click to say "Take stuff from here!")

    The Rat Flute lets you command many Rats at once!

    Oh, you can have this hat too when you buy these! Rats like chef hats. Put on rat, it look great, yes?

§aRats are numerous, but not very hardy, no? Not very strong, but persistant!

    You can breed them with a Rat Cage to make them stronger, yes yes, but there are other ways! With Chemistry!

    Like putting a hat on a Rat, you can put an Upgrade on them too! Right Click them to see, yes?

    You can boost their Health or their Armor so they survive being hit more, or boost Strength, so strong rat can defeat your enemies faster!

§aRats are smart, but can only do so much, yes?

    But with Chemistry, you can improve them!

    Like putting a hat on a Rat, you can put an Upgrade on them too! Right Click them to see, yes?

    Want faster Rats? You can do that with a Speed upgrade!

    What about a Rat like an Ant? Carry entire stacks of items! You can do that too with a Platter upgrade!

§aIs one upgrade not enough? Do you wish to turn your pet rats into powerful allies? Yes? Of course you do!

    The Warrior Upgrade combines all three stat upgrades, yes! Stronger, Healthier, Hardier!

betterquesting:10.name:8: [II] Selling : Rat Upgrades - Whitelist and Blacklist
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§aRats are not picky about what they pick up. Everything is useful in their eyes! Owner wants everything they can find, right?

    If you don't want that, no no, too much stuff (is that possible?), you can use one of these Upgrades to teach the Rat!

    The Whitelist Upgrade tells the Rat that ONLY these items are good!

    The Blacklist Upgrade tells the Rat to get all items BUT these ones. These ones are no good!

§aPiper hats are quite popular! But only the Pied Piper knows how to make them!

    We will pay you for Piper Hats. How you get them is not our concern. Many Rats fear the Piper, others love, much love for the Piper. 

    The Labrats only are interested in how the Hat works...

§aThe Pied Piper! A mystical being to Rats! But not mystery, is real! Can sometimes find them, playing music and leading rats around nighttime in Villages!

    The Piper Hat has magic of its own! Wearing it, Rats will no longer flee from you!

betterquesting:10.name:8: [III] Selling : Upgrade - Rat Crafting and Table
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§aTiny paws are good for delicate work! Rat paws are strong too, can make lots of things! Or some things, at least.

    Rat Crafting upgrade lets your pet Rats be productive, yes! Place onto a Rat Crafting Table and they will craft the recipe you list! Needs materials, of course.

§aRats...WITH WINGS?

    Yes yes! With Science!

§aWhy so expensive?

    Many vegetables in this are rare, very rare! Not tasty to most, only to Rats.

    But there is secret!

    Special kitchen Rat is said to know the secret of the best dish, one to bring back childhood memories.

§aA very special upgrade. By distilling colorful apron knowledge, and data of years of entire food television, we've come up with an excellent upgrade for pet Rats!

   Give this to a Rat, and it will be able to cook any food it picks up!

    Certain things it picks up can ONLY be cooked by your now master chef rat!

§aRap God? No no, ancestor Rats only squeak! (Though their language depends on tone and pitch and number of squeaks and... nevermind!). Squeaking does rhyme all the time though, but...

    No, this upgrade is to turn your pet into a Battle God! Much more powerful than  your standard pet Rat!

    Science is amazing, yes yes?

§aA cold drink now and then is nice, yes no?

    Alcohol is a solvent, sometimes of brain cells. Don't drink too much! Responsible!

    Especially because expensive! Proper Beer Yeast hard to come by these days!

§aChemicals we understand much, including those people wish to put into their bodies, yes?

    Many of these chemicals are fun to human and beastfolk alike, but too much of a good thing is usually a bad thing!

    You imbibe too many Chemicals? This pill can nullify some of them! Make headache less, yes?

    You be careful. Detox pills are expensive! Useful, but pricey, hard to make!

§aIn this time, many many wish to relax for a bit, to forget the horrors of the world. Cannot blame them, no no. Many of these chemicals do not work on Labrats, but some things that don't work on others do. Knowing this is important!

    These we know to be popular among your kind. Be careful when taking, many villages outlaw it, and can be extremely dangerous! Always have Detoxification Pills, yes?

§aDetoxification Pills are quite in demand, yes yes. Many take in too many chemicals, or travel dangerous areas that make them sick, very bad areas.

    If you find Detoxification Pills, we will pay for them!

§aDrinkable Alcohol is loved by many, very many! Proper yeast is hard to find though! Brewing it well just as hard!

    If you can brew it yourself, or find some still good, we will buy!

§aMany mercenaries enjoy these chemicals. We do not, they have little effect on us. But seeing how they effect other beastfolk is intriguing!

    These should effect you, but not everyone enjoys the feeling! We would buy them from you instead, they fetch good price, yes yes?

§2Hey Bandit, now that we've got contact with some Traders, we can start researching how to get back home.§r

    §o"Right. But I gotta ask..."§r

    §2Yes, I'm calling this my Workshop. I'll keep my scanner subroutines working over all the data from the Global Network, there's a lot of little things you should know about this world, and things that will help you get around.§r

    §o"Yes, but what about..."

    §r§2Don't worry, I'll put any special administrative functions on this tab as well. Stuff like updating the Survival Guide (apparently a few Trader groups work together to keep it maintained?), or replacing your Gamma Container if you lose it.

   §r§o"Z..."§r

    §2Yes, Bandit?§r

    §o"WHY is your avatar a ruffian cat now?"§r

    §2Oh! I felt it fit in better with this world. Gotta do what you have to survive in this catastrophically torn dimension.§r

    §oI rubbed my eyes a bit, "I... don't even..."§r

    §2Trust me meow, it works on a lot of different levels.

§r    §oI decided not to ask further. Sometimes, Z's humor programming just confuses me...
No Description

§2Bandit, if you haven't noticed yet, Death is a bit different than back home. The primary differences to note : 

    1) Your minimap can no longer log the location of your death, nor can your chat log.
    2) You still get a Grave key, so at least Death and his powers are here too.
    3) But the Key no longer directs you to your grave. It only makes it glow when you hold the key and you are close by.

    This makes losing and retrieving items a bit more difficult. You can still make waypoints, sure, but if you are on a long journey, you might forget. Be careful what you bring with you on each hunting trip, Bandit.

    To help, I've gotten in contact with a... well, they call themselves a 'Retrieval' crew. For a price, they will go in and magically retrieve items from fallen Mercenaries that have been 'Insured'.

    If you die, and you have something with Item Insurance enchanted on it in your main inventory (not inside a bag, they cannot guarantee the magic will work), they will Retrieve it, and you will respawn with it.§r

    §o"Wait, immediately? How..."§r

    §2Magic.§r

    §o"....right. Right." That was a silly question, I guess.

§4Bandit. I will keep things to the point.

    You have items you don't want to lose, even temporarily, on death. We have a particular set of skills.

    You have money. We like money. 

    You can purchase Insurance contracts from us. Combine them with the item you wish to Insure in an Anvil.

    If you fall in battle, we will know. My Retrieval crew will then collect the item, and return it to your inventory before you even rematerialize.

    How? Let's just say, thats why the price of our service is justified.

    A note. There are three levels of Item Insurance.

    For level I, each Death and Retrieval cycle has a 50% chance of removing the Insurance from the item once you respawn.

§4There are three levels of Item Insurance.

    For level II, each Death and Retrieval cycle has a 33% chance of lowering the Item Insurance level back to I.

§4There are three levels of Item Insurance.

    For level III, each Death and Retrieval cycle has a 25% chance of lowering the Item Insurance level back to II.

§2As you noticed, your Secure Container came into this dimension with you, Bandit. §r

    §o"Yeah, but now its not really a box but a backpack thing..."§r

    §2True, but it gained a new property. Secure containers will respawn with you after you die, along with everything in the container.§r

    §oNow THAT was useful, but... "But... what if I lose it?"§r

    §2Try not to lose your Secure Container GAMMA, okay? I might be able to fabricate a new one, but I'll have to contact a few folks, and the materials for your Secure Container was already hard to get in our world. Here? I don't know, I can check though.

    Calculating... calculating...

    I can fabricate a substandard container every 30 Minekov days (10 hours real time). It will only be 2x2 in size, but it will have the Secure Container Lock property.

    As much as I'd like to help you by just giving you the container, Bandit, I'm going to have to purchase materials from various Traders and carefully organize their fabrication.

§2There are special stones in this world called Waystones. They've apparently existed all throughout history, so they are a fairly ancient magic.

    They enable people to bind to them by Right Clicking them, then they can teleport between different bound Waystones at the cost of some Experience.§r

    §o"Interesting. That should help exploring for sure."§r

    §2Definitely, but they aren't easy to find. Villages tend to find one and set it up for easier Trade routes, and you can very rarely find one out in the wilderness. Beyond that, though, it gets...§r

    §o"Impossible?"§r

    §2Expensive, mostly. There's traveling group of Traders who collect scattered Waystones, and create special tools to utilize them.
§2Return Scrolls can be used to return to the last Waypoint you activated.
§2Bound Scrolls can be bound to a Waystone by Sneak + Right Clicking it onto it. This lets you teleport to Waystones other than the last one you used.

§2The Warp Stone can be bound to a Waystone just like a Bound Scroll, by Sneak + Right Clicking the Warp Stone onto it. 

    Unlike the Bound Scroll, the Warp Stone isn't a one use item. The downside is, you have to wait 5 minutes after using it before you can use it again.

§2It looks like a couple of Drone networks are still up and running in this world. They did a variety of things, but one of the most popular was air delivery.

    Some traders maintain the ground system, and Air Supply Drop Remotes can be used to call in one of three air drops : Livestock, Medical Supplies, or Utility. The first two are kind of obvious... the last one is usually just a couple of resources. May be useful in a pinch?

    Be warned though! Some Raider gangs have taken over one of the Drone networks. Occasionally they'll intercept the call and send some explosives at you. Be sure you are in a clear area before calling Air Drops.

§aChemicals, our lifeblood, yes yes. In more ways than one! Elements. The ingredients of the universe!

    But how does one get them, hm? Well! Chemical Dissolver is the main mechanism!

    Place appropriate items into Chemical Dissolver. Supply Power. Item dissolves over time, leaving behind Chemicals!

    Where to get power? I can't help there, no. Must talk to another trader for Power Generators.

§aSome liquid Chemicals can be turned into solid Chemicals! Liquid to Powder!

    Evaporator takes no power, just time! Can be slower if area is humid though, but still will work, yes!

§aMany time, liquid Chemicals need to be converted into elements! Must be in a beaker, yes! Or turned into their chemical equivelant!

    Atomizer is machine to do this! It needs Power though, don't forget! Must talk to another Trader for that, not Labrats!

§aSometimes, Chemicals in beakers need to be turned back to Liquid! Iron Element into Molten Iron!

    Liquifier is machine you need. Supply with Power (from another Trader), then give Chemical element, then get liquid, yes yes!

§aYou have lots of Chemicals now, yes? Doing science, good good! But how to utilize Chemicals?

    Can consume, yes, but that dangerous. And not as useful. Need machine instead!

    Chemical Combiner machine needs power, and elements and chemicals and things, and it will do what is necessary to combine them into useable items!

    Still cannot generate power, no.

§aSometimes, you have Chemicals that are many combined, and want them seperated. Not many, but there are some!

    Electrolyzer is machine to seperate them back out. Power and Chemical compound and time and then you get seperated Chemicals!

§aMany Chemicals we deal with, but knowledge we deal with as well! Cannot sell product to Mercenaries who don't know what to do with them, yes no?

    Alchemistry Guidebook will help you on path to knowledge!

§2Advanced Chemists can use high powered machinery to play with Chemicals!

    The Fission Reactor is a big machine, takes many blocks to make! It can split Chemicals up at the atomic level, turning them into multiple other Chemicals! 

    It takes Power, of course!

    The machine takes 3 Fission Cores! It will also take 1 Fission Controller, which we also sell! The Alchemistry Guidebook shows how to construct the machine.

    The 98 Fission Casing we do not sell! You must make yourself, by using the other machines to get the resources!

§2Advanced Chemists can use high powered machinery to play with Chemicals!

    The Fission Reactor is a big machine, takes many blocks to make! It can split Chemicals up at the atomic level, turning them into multiple other Chemicals! 

    It takes Power, of course!

    The machine takes 1 Fission Controller! It will also take 3 Fission Cores, which we also sell! The Alchemistry Guidebook shows how to construct the machine.

    The 98 Fission Casing we do not sell! You must make yourself, by using the other machines to get the resources, yes yes!

§2Advanced Chemists can use high powered machinery to play with Chemicals!

    The Fusion Reactor is a big machine, takes many blocks to make! It can smash Chemicals together atomically to make completely different ones!

    It takes Power, of course!

    The machine takes 1 Fusion Controller! It will also take 3 Fusion Cores, which we also sell! The Alchemistry Guidebook shows how to construct the machine.

    The 98 Fusion Casing we do not sell! You must make yourself, by using the other machines to get the resources.

§2Advanced Chemists can use high powered machinery to play with Chemicals!

    The Fusion Reactor is a big machine, takes many blocks to make! It can smash Chemicals together atomically to make completely different ones!

    It takes Power, of course!

    The machine takes 3 Fusion Cores! It will also take 1 Fusion Controller, which we also sell! The Alchemistry Guidebook shows how to construct the machine.

    The 98 Fusion Casing we do not sell! You must make yourself, by using the other machines to get the resources.

§aMixing Chemicals can lead to dangerous substances! Useful but dangerous!

    Potassium Cyanide is quite poisonous if ingested, don't do it! But, many use it in making shiny jewelry!

§aCertain Chemicals can be extracted from certain fungus! Ones that alter brain in strange ways!

    Psilocybin is one, yes yes. Psychoatric Chemical! Causes interesting brain changes, can be dangerous though!

§aBetter health through science! Penicilin was found in mold! Dangerous thing, lead to life saving thing!

    Penicilin can cure effects on body! Also heal a little! Make healthier!

§aMany times, Chemical is both good and bad!

    Epinephrine enhances senses, sometimes oddly! But also sometimes used to treat heart trouble, or bleeding sometimes!

§aChemicals can be quite addicting, yes yes. 

    Caffeine is good example! Found in many many drinks, and some foods too! If its not naturally there, you can add it, did you know that?

§aChemicals can be extremely addicting, bad Chemicals and Good Chemicals!

    Cocaine is a bad one. Very addictive. Very dangerous. But at one point, it was in some soft drinks, and some medicines too!

§aChemical names can get quite complex, yes no?

    This name is quite a muzzle full to say, but short name is much simpler.

    Asprin! Can be used to heal your wounds. Nice and effective!

§aLabrats deal not just in Chemicals, but in Engineering! We specialize in machinery that works off Air Pressure and Heat, things also involved in Chemicals!

    It has been dubbed Pneumaticraft!

    This book very helpful to explaining! Can be quite complex, but does not have to be!

§aCompressed Iron is very important in many Pneumaticraft machines! Helps to contain high pressures!

    Before, you could craft by blowing it up! Does not happen now, no. We are still trying to find out why!

    You can make Compressed Iron in a Pressure Chamber. But you need Compressed Iron to make the Chamber... You can see the catch here, yes?

§2Pneumatic armor is very good! Very useful, yes yes. Can be upgraded with modules! Engineered to be better!

    Don't forget, must be pressurized to function properly!

    When armor purchased from us, you choose two pieces. Choose either Boots or Helmet, then choose eithera Chestpiece or Leggings!

§aSome Traders do not work through the Survival Guide! They are very specialized, yes! 

    There is a small group of Pneumaticraft Engineers who offer a delivery service. They also buy things too!

    They communicate through the Amadron Tablet. It requires Pressure to use though! Be sure to read Pneumaticraft Manual for instructions!

§2Vortex Cannon is fun toy, also can be useful!

    Need to pressurize it first, then you can use it to push creatures away, yes yes!

    Can also aim at ground and launch self into air!

    Must be careful, landing is dangerous if not careful!

§aMinigun is popular weapon among Caravan and Convoy guards! Minigun can be mounted to turret atop vehicle, or atop guard tower looking over a Village or Settlement!

    Minigun ammo is popular too and always in demand! Not hard to make ones self, and can be found regularly when scavenging through ruins.

    Normal Minigun Ammo is the most common to find and easiest to make.

§aMinigun is popular weapon among Caravan and Convoy guards! Minigun can be mounted to turret atop vehicle, or atop guard tower looking over a Village or Settlement!

    Minigun ammo is popular too and always in demand! Not hard to make ones self, and can be found regularly when scavenging through ruins.

    Incendiary Minigun Ammo light targets on fire. Good for dealing with zombies, yes yes.

§aMinigun is popular weapon among Caravan and Convoy guards! Minigun can be mounted to turret atop vehicle, or atop guard tower looking over a Village or Settlement!

    Minigun ammo is popular too and always in demand! Not hard to make ones self, and can be found regularly when scavenging through ruins.

    Weighted Minigun Ammo is much heavier, doesn't fly as far, but packs bigger punch!

§aMinigun is popular weapon among Caravan and Convoy guards! Minigun can be mounted to turret atop vehicle, or atop guard tower looking over a Village or Settlement!

    Minigun ammo is popular too and always in demand! Not hard to make ones self, and can be found regularly when scavenging through ruins.

    Armor-Piercing Minigun Ammo does more damage, and through armor especially! But lot more expensive to manufacture!

§aPlastics are quite popular. Doesn't require as much heat as metal to work, easily recycles and reused.

    We pay a bit for a pile of any color Plastic!

§aPneumaticraft has Security system to help protect your valuables! But not foolproof, can be hacked with enough time and tools!

    Network node items can either help build system, or help destroy it, yes yes. Many Mercenaries and others will buy them, as some can only be found in salvage, yes!

§2The VanilModu are introducing us to a bunch of the Traders they trust. Take the Avian beastfolk here, who've banded together with humans to make The Flock.

    Their representative wants to talk : §r

§9-------------------
    Mercenary! I trust you are in a safe location. The VanilModu would not have introduced us if you weren't survival minded. But constant vigilance must be maintained at all times, merc!

    And these days, survival requires gear! The Overworld is no cakewalk, and then there is the Nether and the End. And other places too! They will sell your soul for a cornchip if they can, merc, don't forget it.

    That's where we come in. What's the best defense? Offense! What's the best offense? More offense! Well, neither are exactly true, but it's a good line, merc.

    We in the flock are arms dealers. We trade in weapons, armors, tools, you name it. Our primary manufacturing is in ArmorPlus and TechGuns, so be sure to squawk at us if you are running low on ordinance, merc.
-------------------§r

    §oWhat a boisterous group. Not bad, though, and they should be quite helpful in keeping me alive.
No Description

§9Many years ago, special manufacturers made use of these workbenches to craft their trad! They have built in systems that are hard to access these days, but The Flock knows!

    There are four workbenches we will pay for if you find them! They are of no use to you, they take special equipment to activate and utilize.

    There's still a few things even a layperson such as yourself can craft on these benches, though. Up to you, though we could really use more of em!

§9Workbenches were really useful for arms manufacturers way back when. They distilled all their tooling and construction process into a single, high tech bench.

    Too bad the art of using them is fairly lost today. We have some folk in The Flock who know how to use them, but thats after years of learning, not to mention searching for working benches, especially the bigger ones!

    The basic Workbench we have spares of, since anyone can work some simple recipes with them.

    Their representative wants to talk : §r

-------------------§r

    §oWhat a boisterous group. Not bad, though, and they should be quite helpful in keeping me alive.
