    There are four workbenches we will pay for if you find them! They are of no use to you, they take special equipment to activate and utilize.

    There's still a few things even a layperson such as yourself can craft on these benches, though. Up to you, though we could really use more of em!

§9Many years ago, special manufacturers made use of these workbenches to craft their trad! They have built in systems that are hard to access these days, but The Flock knows!

    There are four workbenches we will pay for if you find them! They are of no use to you, they take special equipment to activate and utilize.

    There's still a few things even a layperson such as yourself can craft on these benches, though. Up to you, though we could really use more of em!

§9Many years ago, special manufacturers made use of these workbenches to craft their trad! They have built in systems that are hard to access these days, but The Flock knows!

    There are four workbenches we will pay for if you find them! They are of no use to you, they take special equipment to activate and utilize.

    The Champion Bench is so high tech, even we don't know how to use it. Yet! We are constantly researching!

§9Old manufacturers had the secret of infusing Lava into certain items, making them more powerful!

    Unfortunately those secrets were either lost to time, or just don't work at all anymore.

    The Lava Infuser still works on one or two things, but it's probably more profitable to sell us any you find.

§9Resources are a bit harder to come by, especially refined resources like Steel. Well, not so much, as Steel is fairly easy to refine, just most folk don't realize it.

    The old method was pretty costly in materials, but a much simpler way was discovered, one that was pretty obvious in hindsight. But that's okay, cause it makes getting Steel easier, yeah!

§9Regular steel is all well and good for simple things, but some of the weapons we construct have a lot of electrical components in em. So they need a bit even more refined metal!

    Electrical Steel fills that order right. Doesn't mess with the magnets wrong. Doesn't wear the core down. Good stuff, merc!

§9Lava Crystals were the heart of a lot of creations with these Workbenches. They were like condensed elements of Lava, all that heat and power in a little crystal!

    Good luck finding any more pockets of Lava Crystal Ore though. You can sometimes salvage some from the junk, and we'll definitely pay for any you find!

§9Lava Crystals were the heart of a lot of creations with these Workbenches. They were like condensed elements of Lava, all that heat and power in a little crystal! 

    And those folks found a way to unlock their potential, just by infusing... well, they shoved even MORE Lava into the dang things! Made them even more powerful!

    Infused Lava Crystals can be salvaged from stuff, but if you got yourself a Lava Infuser and some Lava, you can easily boost em up yourself. We'll pay a bit more for already Infused crystals, merc, sound good?

§9Have you found any Lava Crystals, merc? We can always use more, but truth be told, they are much more useful to us when Infused.

    Infused with more Lava, of course!

    But those are harder to come by out there. We'd be willing to sell you one of our spare Lava Infusers if you want. Think of it as an investment, as we'll pay more for already Infused Lava Crystals. Good deal, yeah?

betterquesting:10.name:8: [V] Buying : The Gift of the Gods
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
§9This is quite an odd item. The old arms crafters were able to make this strange charm, by twisting some powerful materials together. 

    By using the charm, it would transform into any object that existed in the world.

    Any item.

    This was an issue as anything included exploding bombs, zombies, you name it...

    Well, if you find one of these, you could use it. Good chance you'll just get some rubble.

    Or you can sell it to us. We're still trying to understand how these things work, ourselves.

§9Those underwater monsters sure can do a monster on you if you aren't careful! If you aren't drowning, they are doing some weird magic on you. Or is it natural? We aren't quite sure, but its definitely dangerous!

    Their scales and stuff, though. Those are quite useful. With a bit of work, a bit of Lava Crystal, and bam, you got some great armor!

    Plus, wear the full set, and it's like a set of scuba gear! Breath underwater, but with a bit more protection than an exploding gas tank and a neoprene suit!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9The Ender Dragon is quite a tough monster, guarding the deadly End. Are the Endermen involved? Is it their mayor? Leader? Owner? Or do they just tolerate each other?

    Either way, defeating the dragon is no small feat. And with conquest comes reward! The dragon's scales make fantastic armor, quite strong!

    As well, wearing the full set can grant you the ability to fly like the Ender Dragon! Mostly. You'll see what I mean!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9What's more deadly that the dreaded Ender Dragon?

    Well, it's kind of arguable which is more deadly, but I'd have to say The Wither. The Ender Dragon only calls The End home, while the Wither?

    The Wither comes to wherever its effigy is built, destroying all who dare exist near it.

    The heart of the Wither is a powerful item called a Nether Star. And from it, we forge armor the shines bright as the stars. The Super Star Armor is incredibly strong, weathering many attacks.

    The full set? Wearing that causes your body to constantly regenerate itself. What the armor cannot stop, your body will heal over time.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9You've seen our Guardian armor. Our Dragon and our Wither armor as well. Each one stronger than the last.

    But the coup de grace of our line of Monsterous Armors is The Ultimate Armor.

    Providing unparalleled protection, unparalleled looks!

    And wearing the full set? Well, you might as well be in the Avengers, merc. Or maybe Thanos. We know how you mercs roll. Just leave us out of your calculations, alright?

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Not into guns as much? Or prefer the much more quiet twang of a bow over the somewhat muted cough of a silenced pistol?

    We have a special line of arrows you might be interested in then!

    Coal Arrows cause Blindness in whoever you hit. Great for messing up the aim of that Zombie Farmer, though I don't know if their aim is all that great to start with, merc.

    Lapis Arrows cause Nausea instead. Not sure it'll do much good against a Skeleton, but against a Raider or other Scav? Won't be pretty.

    Redstone Arrows slow down your target instead! Real good against those Scavs hopped up on some crazy chemical that charge you.

    These arrows pack a bit of a punch on their own in case their special properties don't take effect!

§9Our special line of arrows doesn't stop with those two! These are the SPECIAL ones, real special, merc!

    We have a special line of arrows you might be interested in then!

    Infused Lava arrows will light the target on fire. Seriously on fire, I mean, you are hitting them when concentrated Lava crystals.

    Ender Dragon Arrows are the top of the line. Hit the target, and they just start to Wither away, like a crazy acidic poison.

    These arrows pack a bit of a punch on their own in case their special properties don't take effect!

§9Wither Skeletons love hanging out in The Nether. You know, home of metric tons of Lava, the same thing that powers the Lava Crystals!

    Their bones are blackened from the heat, whatever cosmic magic keeping them alive holding it all in, and they have a lot of bones.

    Most of the bones are pretty normal. Hey you can occasionally get a normal, bone white bone from them too! But usually they drop a variety of scorched bones.

    One in particular looks quite odd. The Wither Bone is a special bone they drop, that we will pay you for, merc.

§9The seas always seem like a boring place, until you find one of those sea temple things. They got some good stuff in em, even after all this time, but they also got some pretty rough monsters guarding them.

    Guardians do some crazy stuff to fight you off, but their scales are well worth picking up, cause we can use them for a variety of arms and armor!

§9The Ender Dragon is an imposing creature to see, let alone fight. But you know merc, with our gear and  your tenacity, we're dang sure you can smash that big lizard out of the sky!

    Those scales? We can use em. Make some really good armor. We'll pay of course, just get all you can.

§9The old workers of these Workbenches came up with an amazing material. It mixed together strong, powerful materials into a kind of alloy. They called it the Ultimate Material.

    Unfortunately we don't know how they made it. Ulti-Benches have the data, but we've not unlocked the ability to make it yet. For now, though, we have to rely on mercs like yourself to find and scavenge it for us.

§9Now wait, before you say anything like "Coal armor? COAL?", hear me out, merc.

    You know how some Diamonds are formed? Pressure. Lots of pressure. Coal. And. Pressure

    This is just kind of a few steps below diamond, sure. But it comes with one big benefit, especially with the lack of city lights at night.

    A full set will grant you Night Vision if you wear it!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Lapis is some interesting stuff. Not quite valuable like Diamonds or Emeralds, but arguably just as useful for survival. Can't enchant your gear without it, and enchanting gives a good soldier the edge they need to survive!

    It also makes some decent armor to wear. Plus, wear the full set, and it's like having a scuba tank built in! 

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Redstone, the basis of a lot of machinery, both old world and new. This stuff always surprises us with new ways people find uses for it. Like us!

    Redstone Armor isn't half bad for the price. But where it really shines is when a full set is worn, you get a nice boost to how fast you can do things!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Emerald is sometimes considered the lesser Diamond. Everyone hunts for Diamond this, Diamond that, they forget about the Emerald! Until it comes trading time at the Village, then oops, Emeralds might be important again!

    But it definitely has its uses beyond a trade good. Emerald Armor, for example, is just slightly less robust than Diamond armor, but the tradeoff?

    A full set will make you move a heckuva lot faster!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Know how hard Obsidian is? Pretty blast resistant, a pain to collect if you find a patch of it. 

    So of course, we made some armor out of it! It's not much better than Iron, until you wear a full set of it. Then you get even more Resistant! Better than the sum of its pieces or... well, however that saying goes, merc.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Infused Lava Crystals are super useful, both powering our Workbenches, and helping to turn basic materials into hardy, powerful armaments.

    So of course we're going to make armor out of it!

    Not quite as good as Diamond armor, but I prefer it if I'm tredging into The Nether, as the full set will give you Fire Resistance!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9You know, we in The Flock like our jokes. The world is a bleak place, so humor, parties, celebration keeps the spirits up!

    One day we decided to make some costumes with the Workbenches. They had the patterns, so why not? Hey, a chicken suit, that should be amusing! Chicken Armor? Weird name but okay.

    Whew. When one of us put on the full suit, none of us could catch them during Tag! So Speedy!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Slimes are strange creatures, merc. Really strange. They are kinda cute but will smash you and throw you off a cliff given a chance! If they are large enough, that is. The tiny ones are REALLY determined to at least try, I gotta say!

    Slime, the substance I mean this time, is pretty strange too. Kinda liquid, kinda solid. Make a block out of it, and its like a trampoline! So what about armor?

    Well, it kinda makes weak armor. But a full set of it? Makes you REALLY jumpy!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Ardite's a rare material that used to be found in The Nether. It made decently strong armaments, but was mostly used as part of a much stronger alloy!

    It's pretty durable stuff, pretty close to Diamond, but with the addition of being Fire Resistant if you wear the full set!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Cobalt used to be an uncommon ore you could gather in The Nether, but nowadays it's pretty rare to find when scavenging. It's pretty strong on its own, but it was mainly alloyed with another rare Nether metal.

    It's decent as armor on a piece by piece basis. But where it shines, merc, is the full set. It'll hasten those hands of yours, making digging through rubble and ruin much easier!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Ardite and Cobalt are decently strong metals on their own. But alloy them together? Well, merc, thats when you get something called Manyullyn. It's also a very pretty color too, I'd say!

    Not only is it strong and durable, it'll make YOU strong and durable too! A full set will not only protect you like Diamond armor, but make your attacks hit even harder!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9To this day, none of us in The Flock can understand Pig Iron. It's a really weird alloy, that does really weird things! Some weapons made with it make Bacon pop out of enemies. 

    Yes, I said Bacon. 

    So, with that, what if we made some armor with it? We were able to retool the regular Iron recipe in the Workbench with Pig Iron and well...

    It's okay? Well actually its pretty decent out in the field. It helps keep your food Saturated! Not as much need to eat out in the field, merc! I mean, as long as you got a full set on.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Merc, I'm pretty sure you've seen our Slime armor, right? Not very protective, but really helpful in getting to higher ledges, scaling mountains and ruins, the usual!

    Well, we wanted something a bit more protective but still able to get you to places. So we used this strange alloy we found called Knightslime, to make an armor line somewhere between Iron and Slime armor.

    It ain't as protective as armor, but the full set will let you jump a lot higher. Not as much as Slime armor, but tradeoffs must be made, merc.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9You got any spare Chainmail, Iron, Gold, or Diamond armor laying about, merc? You got a couple choices with it.

    You could probably sell it on the Flea Market for pennies. Maybe melt it down somehow to some useful resources.

    Or you can take our special Enhanced enchantment and toss it on your armor. Bam, upgraded!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are pretty basic weapons, but each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Coal Sword can Blind the target. The Redstone and Lapis Swords can make then Nauseated. The Emerald Sword can slow the target down.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Bows are great weapons to use in place of guns. Arrows tend to be easier to make, and a lot of monsters don't easily shrug off the damage you can cause.

    Raider Scavs though, are another matter. You know, cause of armor?

    These aren't the best of materials to make a bow with, but they aren't bad!

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are a bit beefier than their sword counterparts, and each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Coal Battle Axe can Blind the target. The Redstone and Lapis Battle Axes can make then Nauseated. The Emerald Battle Axe can slow the target down.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are pretty basic weapons, but each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Obsidian Sword can Weaken the target. The Lava Infused Sword can light the target on fire.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Melee weapons may seem antiquated, but a good soldier always has a backup when their gun jams or they run out of metal to throw.

    These are a bit beefier than their sword counterparts, and each one can inflict more than just damage on an enemy : 

    The Obsidian Battle Axe can Weaken the target. The Lava Infused Battle Axe can light the target on fire.

    Each weapon purchase comes with your choice of pickaxe as well!

§9Bows are great weapons to use in place of guns. Arrows tend to be easier to make, and a lot of monsters don't easily shrug off the damage you can cause.

    Raider Scavs though, are another matter. You know, cause of armor?

§9The Ultimate Armor. The top tier of the top tier in personal defense, merc! 

    The creation of such an armor is quite an undertaking, with a cost to match.

    But you can help make both of our jobs easier, merc. Each piece of Ultimate Armor is made up of smaller pieces, each piece containing another piece of armor. This is how it blends so many benefits into one armor : It contains 4 other entire sets of armor!

    Where was I? Oh, right! It takes a lot of time and energy and resources to make a piece of Ultimate Armor, so in the old days each piece was split into 3 parts, and manufacturing was done by multiple different Workshops.

    You can still find those pieces of armor as salvge. If you can get one of those, we'll pay you a decent amount for them!

§9These odd trophies seem to pop up every once on a while. They are different than the ones we're used to, and it seems our predecessors made mini holographic trophies to commemorate the various creatures in the world.

    If you can find one of them, we'll pay for them. We're trying to complete collections in many of The Flock's workshops.

§9Arms and Armor manufacturers had a wide variety of workbenches and machines to do their job. Some of them were pretty simple things that required no power, all they needed were the tools and components built in.

    The Camo Bench is useful in changing how a lot of blocks look, mostly our TechGun line of blocks, but occasionally some others too, like Wool.

    The Repair Bench is tooled specifically to help you repair TechGun armor lines.

§9Manufacturers used a wide variety of workbenches to make so many things. It's not as easy for us to make the benches just like they had (lack of giant sprawling factories and precision micro fabricators is an issue...)

    So we always are on the look out for salvaged versions from mercs like yourself. The Camo Bench and Repair Bench are pretty common ones, but we'll still buy the pair from ya.

§9We sell a variety of arms to protect yourself while out scavenging, merc. And with such a wide variety of firearms, comes a wide variety of ammunition!

    Here we have ammunition for weapons that start showing up in Tier 1 of our arms offerings : Hand Cannon, Pistol, Revolver, Mac 10.

    We also offer the Stick Grenade for sale!

    Be sure to check the weapon you are wanting to use, and always keep a good stock of ammo on you at all times!

    Just a little tip, merc. Ammo is always at a premium, so it might be better for you to make it yourself and sell any extra back to us! We both profit that way.

    It's also cheaper to buy loose ammo and reload magazines you've already got, than it is to buy prefilled mags, merc. Just a little tip!

§9Ammo is at an all time premium in this day and age, merc. We'll gladly buy all spare ammunition you can supply us with.

    Heck, getting yourself an Ammo Press and the resources would be cheaper than buying it, and any excess you make can be sold (to us) for a nice profit, I have to say!

§9Salvaging through ruins and abandoned cities, you are quite likely to come across bits and pieces of guns. Whether from older times, or from various Raiders or other mercenaries tearing down weapons they find, we could use all the parts you can find, merc!

§9Arms and Armor manufacturers had a wide variety of workbenches and machines to do their job. These machines take power to run, which you'll have to figure out how to provide. Power generation isn't really our thing, merc.

    The Metal Press is mostly a useful machine for us arms manufacturers, but there are a few things that might be of use to you. Specifically some ammo can only be made in this metal Press

    The Chemical Laboratory is useful for making certain ammo, or enriching materials.

    The Turret is a good piece of base defense. You can mount most any TechGun onto it, and load it up with ammo, and it will protect you.

    The Charging Station's whole job is to recharge your Redstone Batteries and Energy Cells for your weapons.

§9Manufacturers used a wide variety of workbenches to make so many things. It's not as easy for us to make the benches just like they had (lack of giant sprawling factories and precision micro fabricators is an issue...)

§9Some of the things we create are so fantastical we can hardly believe them sometimes. Well, only sometimes. 

    Take this Anti-Gravity device. Place it on your back and you fly around like some sort of magic wielding diety. It'll slowly break down, but you'll get a good amount of flight time out of each one!

§9Without the lights of cities being everywhere, the darkness is quite a bit darker nowadays, merc. And that's dangerous when you are out scavenging, because who knows what, or who, is lurking and sneaking about?

    With these Night Vision goggles, you can cut through that and get a good view of the situation. They'll slowly consume charge of the Redstone Battery, but just throw it into a Charging Station or something to fix that!

§9Many TechGun machines, like the Fabricator, can be upgraded to work faster if you toss these Machine Upgrades into them.

§9We have a lot of little pieces of gear that might be useful to you in various situations, merc. They all cost about the same, so just choose one from this list : 

    The Gas Mask protects you from breathing in Radiation.

    A pair of Gas Mask Filters, since eventually they will run out in the mask.

    An Oxygen mask, which lets you breath underwater or in other low oxygen situations.

    An Oxygen Tank, which you need to wear with the Oxygen Mask. Refill it with a Compressed Air Tank when it runs out.

    Mining Gloves, which help speed up your mining ability when worn.

    Tactical Mask, which is very tactical and protects your face.

    A Beret, which looks 100% awesome.

§9Along with Armor and Arms, we produce a bunch of helpful gadgets for mercs to utilize in their salvage ops. Backpack contained systems are quite popular, for example!

    The Glider lets you... well, glide, if you hold Sneak while falling! Instead of just falling like a rock that is. It doesn't require recharging or replacing components like the other gadgets here.

    The Jump Pack uses Compressed Air tanks, and lets you leap up pretty high! It also lowers fall damage, cause what use is it if you leap up only to land and break a leg? Oh, you might want to disable your "Auto Step Up" in the options, unless you like superleaping everywhere...

    The Jetpack uses Fuel Tanks and lets you fly around. It doesn't lower fall damage so try not to run out of Fuel mid flight, merc...

§9There's a couple useful tools we sell. Okay we sell a lot of tools, but these two are sort of special

    The Crowbar is kind of like a Wrench. You can hit people with it, but you can also Right Click it on TechGun machines to rotate them around. Sneak + Right Click can either dismantle machines, or in the case of TechGun doors, configure their security settings.

§9What good is a base of operations if the only entrance is protected by a flimsy wooden door?

    This variety of TechGuns brand doors are much better! You can Sneak + Right Click our Crowbar or another wrench onto them to configure them. 

    The Hangar doors connect to each other as well, so when you activate one, any of them 'touching' will activate at the same time.

§9Did you hit one of the irradiated areas, merc? Hopefully you have some Anti-RAD drugs on ya.

    No? Well, we always have a lot to spare. Some of the materials we work with have been irradiated from one disaster or another, until we de-RAD it at least.

    Anti-RAD Pills will heal a bit of Radiation buildup and boost your natural defenses against it.

    RadAway will rapidly heal a lot of Radiation buildup over time.

§9Now I know it's not a great look to Villagers, but Bandit Armor is widely worn for a reason.

    With it on, you are freer to move around, getting about faster. You also can fall from higher locations, and take less damage if you land hard.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9The Miner's Outfit is a great bit of cheaper armor, because not only does it protect you a bit, it also increases your mining speed!

    You also move around faster as well!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9If you plan on going into a Rad saturated situation, merc, you best bring along some RAD gear. Bigger power armors protect you a bit, but are quite expensive. 

    If you don't plan on getting into a drawn out fire fight, I suggest at least bringing a Hazmat Suit. It helps you resist RAD building up

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Soldier's Armor provides a decent bit of protection for a decent price.

    Not as fancy as a lot of other armors, but it will protect you from getting knocked back.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Combat Armor is a good armor to get around the battlefield in, providing a boost of speed. Like Soldier's Armor, it also helps you resist getting knocked back a bit.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9The first of the Power Armors, Steam Armor is powered with Compressed Air tanks. It provides a good amount of protection!

    Power Armor requires the Chest piece to function. It will automatically 'load' replacement power items when it runs out, as long as its in your inventory.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Commando Armor is a great armor for both defense and utility. Not only does it let you fall farther and take less damage when you do, it also lets you perform mining operations under water.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Ranger Veteran Armor is a good all around armor.

    It boosts your movement speed and increases your resistance to getting knocked back.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Advanced Combat Armor is an improvement on regular Combat Armor, providing much more protection and durability.

    To boot, it also increases your movement speed and knockback resistance even more!

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9The second tier of Power Armor we provide, the Exo Suit is powered by Energy Cells. 

    An enhanced version of Advanced Combat Armor, the Exo Suit not only improves on the speed and knockback resistance, it also provides a boost to your mining speed!

    Power Armor requires the Chest piece to function. It will automatically 'load' replacement power items when it runs out, as long as its in your inventory.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9The HEV Suit is a long sought after piece of kit, both useful and quite iconic. It is powered by Energy Cells.

    The HEV Suit provides decent protection against RADs and knockback, it also boosts both regular and underwater mining speeds!

    Power Armor requires the Chest piece to function. It will automatically 'load' replacement power items when it runs out, as long as its in your inventory.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9The top tier of TechGun armors, iconic and strong. It is powered by Energy Cells.

    Power Armor boosts the wearer's heatlh outright, and adds a decent amount of knockback protection and a boost to mining speed.

    Power Armor requires the Chest piece to function. It will automatically 'load' replacement power items when it runs out, as long as its in your inventory.

    To get you kitted out nice and quick, merc, each purchase comes with two pieces of the armor set! Either a Helmet or Boots, and then either a Chestpiece or Leggings. Mix and match as needed!

§9Our TechGuns line of arms and armor and machines have some little things that the customer should know about.

    So there is a handy dandy manual you can purchase to help you out!

§2Bandit, we've been contacted by a group that calls themselves The YAP. Yes, I know, I thought so too. I've looked into them and they are... legitimate, in a way. They are an approved Trader group, at least.

    According to the VanilModu they are thieves, but honorable ones. And with a good fashion sense. They are primarily interested in clothing and goods from a wide variety of sources

    I'll patch you in to their representative : §r

§b-------------------
    Yo. Bandit, was it? Or merc? Nah I like Bandit, it's a good name, yeh! New mercs are always nice, especially interesting ones. Very interesting ones. Nah that's not important right now, but you are probably wondering about us, yeh? Well...

    Having trouble getting somewhere? The YAP can help you; worldwide. Got some odd salvage? The YAP can buy it; certified. Need to look good in this wasteland? The YAP can dress you; verified.

    A lot of this world is abandoned and full of rough and tumble scavs. Lots to explore, lots to loot. And lots of ways to make a fashion statement.
-------------------§r

    §oHmm, not the first time I've had to work with seedier individuals. Something tells me they are on the up and up, as long as I'm not a scav...
No Description

§bSometimes when you beat a scav at their own game, their magic life essence hits the ground. Looks like a video game heart! In that state, you can't really do anything with it though.

    I mean, other than sell it to us, yeh! We know how to turn them into useful accessories.

    The Red Heart is the most common you can find, so they won't get you much. Better than the Flea Market though!

§bWhat a rough world it is, Bandit. Quite rough. Hazardous, even, yeh. Armor's a good way to protect yourself, but it can slow you down. And there's things, both creatures and weapons, that can slice through armor like butter. And armor, even sealed power armor, is no good against certain magic.

    What's a mercenary to do, hm? Well, The YAP has a solution for you. It's called Baubley Heart Canisters.

    Sometimes the magic force of a creature flutters to the ground. Their heart? Nah, just a bit of magic shaped like a heart. Looks like a video game heart, if you've come across any working game system these days.

    Anyways, we in The YAP know how to turn these into nice little accessories to increase your health. Each one stacks up to 10 in one of your Bauble accessory slots (see that little circle in your Inventory portrait? click it!).

    There's four colors of Heart Canister, each one rarer than the last.

    Red is the most common, and therefore the cheapest!

§2Since we've gained reputation rank II with the VanilModu, they've been kind enough to get us in contact with a few other traders. Like our own dimension, this one has a mix of humans and anthros, called Beastfolk here. Seems the multiple catastrophies accelerated the evolution of many species, including this group called the Labrats.

    Here, I'll let them talk to you now, Bandit. : §r

§a-------------------
    Ah yes yes, hello Bandit. The VanilModu are very much kind to be bringing us new mercs to deal with. The world is dangerous, and many do not last long, no no.

    No doubt you've already had to deal with our small, unintelligent ancestors, yes? No? Perhaps your larders are a bit lessened of food? Holes in the wall? We can help you deal with them, but that is not our purpose in life. Our grand purpose!

    We wish to understand the universe. What makes every single thing, down to the basic elements. Then... we can rebuild it, yes yes. A better world. 

    Through Chemistry, we break it down.

    Through Engineering, we build it up.

    But what we lack is Materials. Money. Chemicals. Test subjects. 

    Can you help provide these, maybe yes? At least some money, and some of the basic materials we need. Provide these to us, and we'll provide you with SCIENCE!
-------------------§r

    §oKnowing there are both humans and anthros in this world is comforting in a way. The last dimensional mishap we had, the only sentient creature were slugs... slugs everywhere. That was... interesting.

    Tangents aside, the Labrats look like they'll give me access to the first thing I'll need if I want to fix this mess I've gotten myself into : chemistry equipment.

§bBandit, if you ever come across one of these empty heart canisters, we'll buy em. The YAP members sometimes fall in battle and their goods looted, and empty canisters are commonly amongst their belongings.

§bTougher creatures have bigger life forces. Takes a lot to take them down, and their life magic is likewise bigger, and harder to contain.

    There's four colors of Heart Canister, each one rarer than the last.

    Orange is the next step up from Red.

§bHave you faced down The Wither yet? Maybe some other imposingly dangerous monster? Betcha the life heart they dropped was Orange instead of Red!

    Heart Canisters can only stack up to 10, but more powerful hearts mean more powerful life forces means BIGGER STACKS, Bandit!

§bVery few creatures have the life force to overcome the Orange Heart Barrier. 

    But there is one, hovering around The End. The YAP knows how to contain that life force for a price.

    There's four colors of Heart Canister, each one rarer than the last.

    Green hearts are the second rarest heart canister.
§bSquared off against the Ender Dragon have you? Got a nice green heart? Yeah I know it should probably be red or orange for fire...or maybe purple. But it's green, and its worth a lot to us!

§bSometimes, it isn't about how strong your own life force is, but how much you can steal from others.

    Tales tell of an evil Illager deep in the woods who carries the blue heart. We've come across a few blue hearts in our trades, and The YAP has wares to sell, of course.

    There's four colors of Heart Canister, each one rarer than the last.

    Blue is the rarest heart to find.

§bTrapse off into the woods, Bandit. Find a spooky mansion, maybe bring a dog along and a weird guy in an ascot as well. Unmask the... oh wait, it's not a mask, its an evil Illager! And he's stolen a lot of life essence.

    If you are lucky, the Illager might have dropped a Blue Heart, the gathered life force.

§bFinding other things you want to accessorise yourself with, but finding Heart Canisters too valuable?

    The YAP has a solution! The Heart Amulet can carry all four types of Heart Canisters, and only take one Bauble slot!

§bThe burned skeletons in The Nether are special, sought after by multiple Traders, including ourselves! They are part of the secret of unlocking the Heart Canister!

    They drop multiple kinds of bones. Others Traders are interested in other bones, but The YAP is interested in Wither Bones!
§bIt is a long shot, but if you come across one of these Jewel Apples, Bandit, we'll buy em from you. Why? Oh, quite a delicacy, and something quite special.
Great, where are we now? Time to get our bearings and figure out where we landed this time...

This is the first Trader group new Traders and Mercenaries deal with when they want to break into the business. Others we'll have to find in person to deal with...

    [Trades Vanilla Minecraft and Modular Machinery items.]

The Labrat trade group consists of the most widespread of the Beastfolk races. From their roots, they've become some of the best chemists and engineers.

    [Trades Rats, Alchemistry, Drugs and Pills, and Pneumatricraft items.]

Now that we have our bearings, we need to get to work if we want to get out of here. Z should be able to help us survive.
    [Z will explain mechanics and sell survival items like Waystones and Insurance. Z also has the main questline, as well as Administrative functions like updating the questbook]

The Flock. A... well, a flock of birds and humans really. They all wear helmets or masks that look like birds, so at a glance its hard to tell them apart, which looks to be the point.

    [Trades ArmorPlus and Techguns items.]

The YAP, a crew of professional (if you can really call it professional...) level looters and... fashionistas. Need to know how to get around, break into abandoned places, and look good doing it? Talk to The YAP

    [Trades Baubley Heart Canisters, Grappling Hook, Hooked, Little Looter, Varied Commodities, Clothing Plus, and Cloth Mod]
